WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for logging this issue. We've moved to a new codebase on GitHub; please try your issue against the new compiler (once possible) and log an issue on the GitHub site if it still reproduces.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi, as mentioned in the subject, the back and forward navigation buttons ([found on the side of a mouse](http://www.google.com/imgres?imgurl=http://i.stack.imgur.com/Aizsw.png&imgrefurl=http://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/32923/how-can-i-enable-the-back-button-of-a-razer-mouse&h=220&w=424&sz=16&tbnid=hede54_xA95WLM:&tbnh=90&tbnw=173&zoom=1&usg=__ZM4Yj0YeMfP940yA-ASzrT4ZNBk=&docid=-0F6QCHT4_RCJM&sa=X&ei=TvtSUubTBoSi0QWg6YCABw&ved=0CFwQ9QEwBw)) do not work in TypeScript files in Visual Studio.

Their purpose is to navigate to the last caret position.

However, the back and forward buttons on the "Standard" toolbar work as expected, as do the corresponding keyboard shortcuts  Cntrl + - and Cntrl + Shift + -.

The mouse navigation buttons work correctly in C# code files.
WorkItem.Summary: Mouse Back/Forward does not work in TS files

Comments.Message: Thanks for the report. Surprising that this is happening, marked as active.
